body.p: Which one of the following statements is correct about using the z-test for p?

multiple_choice.choice: It is safe to use the z-test for p.
It is not safe to use the z-test for p, since the sample is not a random sample from the entire population (or cannot be considered as one).
It is not safe to use the z-test for p since n * po is not large enough.
It is not safe to use the z-test for p since n * (1 - po) is not large enough.

response.feedback: Correct. Indeed, all the conditions are met: (a) the sample is random; (b) n * po = 1,308 * 0.75 = 981 ≥ 10; and (c) n * (1 - po) = 1,308 * 0.25 = 327 ≥ 10.
Incorrect. The sample is a random sample from the entire population (all households that have Internet connection).
